intro: Thacombauia, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves composed of several oval-shaped leaflets. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a popular ornamental species. Thacombauia thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
